title: Schema dump corrupts enum types with commas in their names
body:
### Steps to reproduce
```ruby
#!/usr/bin/env ruby

require "bundler/inline"

gemfile(true) do
  source "https://rubygems.org"

  gem "rails", github: "rails/rails", branch: "main"
  gem "pg"
end

require "active_record/railtie"
require "minitest/autorun"

ENV["DATABASE_URL"] = "postgresql://localhost/ar_enum_test"

class TestApp < Rails::Application
  config.load_defaults Rails::VERSION::STRING.to_f
  config.eager_load = false
  config.logger = Logger.new($stdout)
  config.secret_key_base = "secret_key_base"
  config.active_record.schema_format = :ruby
end
Rails.application.initialize!
ActiveRecord::Tasks::DatabaseTasks.create_current

ActiveRecord::Schema.define do
  create_enum :funky_enum, ["Yes", "Yes, with reservations", "No"]
end

class BugTest < ActiveSupport::TestCase
  def test_funky_enum_gets_dumped_correctly
    output = StringIO.new

    ActiveRecord::SchemaDumper.dump(ActiveRecord::Base.connection_pool, output)

    # It gets dumped as:
    # create_enum \"funky_enum\", [\"Yes\", \"Yes\", \" with reservations\", \"No\"]

    assert_includes output.string, "create_enum \"funky_enum\", [\"Yes\", \"Yes, with reservations\", \"No\"]"
  end
end

```

### Expected behavior
The `SchemaDumper` should dump enums correctly, allowing for commas in their values.

### Actual behavior
The `SchemaDumper` splits enum types on commas, corrupting `schema.rb` on every schema dump.

### System configuration
**Rails version**: 8.0.1

**Ruby version**: 3.2.1
